main event: Flaming object generally described as similar to a phosphorous bomb, seen over Watford City, North Dakota, about 10:00 PM.
interesting points: The object was whitish in color and appeared to be about 100 feet in diameter.
It moved fairly slowly and went out behind a hill.
The sighting was similar to a previous one made at Macon, Georgia, by a military observer.
The report is by a local cattleman.
A red glow was observed overhead, which appeared to be some kind of scanning radar or other equipment installed in the craft.
sighted object: Flaming object, whitish in color, about 100 feet in diameter
